words.definition: To arise is to happen.
words.example: Difficulties arose with his computer because it was old.

words.definition: A benefactor is a person who gives money to help someone.
words.example: The student's benefactor gave him money to spend on his studies.

words.definition: A blacksmith is a person who makes things out of metal.
words.example: The blacksmith pounded the piece of metal until it was flat.

words.definition: When someone is charitable, they help people who are in need.
words.example: My sister was charitable enough to help me buy my first house.

words.definition: A chimney is a tall pipe used to carry smoke out of a building.
words.example: The cat was on the roof sitting next to the chimney.

words.definition: To compensate is to pay someone for the time they spent doing something.
words.example: Her boss compensated her for the extra work she did last week.

words.definition: If you encounter something, you meet or come close to it.
words.example: I encountered a sea turtle while I was swimming.

words.definition: To exceed is to be more than something.
words.example: Since I exceeded my limit, I decided to get rid of my credit cards.

words.definition: To forge is to make or produce, especially with difficulty.
words.example: Stacy and Heather forged their friendship when they were teenagers.

words.definition: People who are humble do not believe that they are better than other people.
words.example: Even though Bob is the smartest boy in his class, he is humble.

words.definition: Iron is a strong metal that is used to make many objects.
words.example: The horse had shoes made of iron.

words.definition: A ladder is an object that is used to climb up and down things.
words.example: He used a ladder to climb to the top of his tree house.

words.definition: If people are modest, they do not think that they are too important.
words.example: Derek is very modest for someone who is so rich.

words.definition: To occupy a place is to live, work, or be there.
words.example: Kevin and Alice occupied the chairs and had a long discussion.

words.definition: A penny is a coin worth one cent.
words.example: U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is on the penny.

words.definition: To preach is to talk about and promote a religious idea.
words.example: Aaron often preached about living an honest life.

words.definition: To prosper is to be successful or make a lot of money.
words.example: Frank's new business finally prospered after many years of hard work.

words.definition: A province is a small area that is controlled by a country.
words.example: Canada is divided into several different provinces.

words.definition: Satisfaction is a feeling you get when you do or receive something good.
words.example: Brad was filled with satisfaction when he saw what was for dinner.

words.definition: To sustain something is to keep it going.
words.example: Wind power is a clean way to sustain a city with energy.
